justification: "After the job characteristic measures for all 10 jobs, participants completed the Protestant Work Ethic (PWE) Scale (Mirels & Garrett, 1971)"

measured_by: six Work Ethos items from the World Values Survey
justification: "participants completed ... six items on Work Ethos tapping perceptions of work as good from the 2000-2004 wave of the World Values Survey"

measured_by: five trait-adjective ratings (Competent, Talented, Logical, Organized, Intelligent)
justification: "The traits were selected to capture evaluations of competence ("Competent," "Talented," "Logical," "Organized," and "Intelligent")"

measured_by: five trait-adjective ratings (Warm, Agreeable, Sociable, Funny, Happy)
justification: "The traits were selected to capture ... warmth ("Warm," "Agreeable," "Sociable," "Funny," and "Happy")"

measured_by: five trait-adjective ratings (Moral, Responsible, Dedicated, Honest, Principled)
single 7-point item ‘How much effort do you think X puts into his work?’
justification: "Participants then responded to 15 face-valid questions on 7-point scales, such as, 'How much effort do you think Justin/Mark puts into his work?'"

measured_by: six-item scale (Moral, Trustworthy, Honest, Respectful, Just, Cooperative)
justification: "Core goodness was measured with six items: 'Moral,' 'Trustworthy,' 'Honest,' 'Respectful,' 'Just,' and 'Cooperative.'"

measured_by: seven-item scale (Dedicated, Responsible, Principled, Determined, Motivated, Disciplined, Self-controlled)
justification: "Value commitment was measured using seven items: 'Dedicated,' 'Responsible,' 'Principled,' 'Determined,' 'Motivated,' 'Disciplined,' and 'Self-controlled.'"
